cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1015 MI...1635 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP3 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Eight-E Advisory Number 7 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP082017 800 PM PDT Wed Jul 19 2017
...DEPRESSION FORECAST TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW IN A DAY OR TWO...
SUMMARY OF 800 PM PDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...13.9N 122.2W ABOUT 1015 MI...1635 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...30 MPH...45 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WSW OR 245 DEGREES AT 6 MPH...9 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1009 MB...29.80 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 PM PDT (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Eight-E was located near latitude 13.9 North, longitude 122.2 West. The depression is moving toward the west-southwest near 6 mph (9 km/h). A slow motion toward the southwest and then south is expected during the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds are near 30 mph (45 km/h) with higher gusts. Little change in strength is forecast during the next 48 hours, and the depression is expected to become a remnant low in a day or two.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1009 mb (29.80 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Berg
NNNN
